Documentation.name: UML Profile for METCE data specifications
Documentation.notes: This profile defines a set of stereotypes and tagged values for defining application schemas for METCE data specifications.

Stereotype.name: applicationSchema
Stereotype.notes: A METCE application schema according to ISO 19109 and the Generic Conceptual Model.

Tag.name: targetNamespace
Tag.description: Target XML namespace of the application schema

Tag.name: xmlns
Tag.description: Namespace prefix to be used as short form of the target namespace

Tag.name: version
Tag.description: Current version of the application schema

Tag.name: xsdDocument
Tag.description: Name of an XML Schema document to create representing the content of this package

Tag.name: gmlProfileSchema
Tag.description: URL of the schema location of a GML profile (optional)

Stereotype.name: leaf
Stereotype.notes: A package that is not an application schema and contains no packages.

Tag.name: xsdDocument
Tag.description: Name of an XML Schema document to create representing the content of this package

Tag.name: xsdEncodingRule
Tag.description: XML Schema encoding rule to apply

Tag.name: noPropertyType
Tag.description: Surpress creation of a standard property type that supports inline or by-reference encoding (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule).

Tag.name: byValuePropertyType
Tag.description: Create a property type that requires that the instance is encoded inline (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule).

Tag.name: isCollection
Tag.description: Identifies the feature type as a feature collection.

Stereotype.name: type
Stereotype.notes: A type that is not directly instantiable, but is used as an abstract collection of operation, attribute and relation signatures.

Tag.name: noPropertyType
Tag.description: Surpress creation of a standard property type that supports inline or by-reference encoding (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule).

Tag.name: byValuePropertyType
Tag.description: Create a property type that requires that the instance is encoded inline (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule).

Tag.name: isCollection
Tag.description: Identifies the type as an object collection.

Stereotype.notes: A type with identity that is not a spatial object type.

Tag.name: xsdEncodingRule
Tag.description: XML Schema encoding rule to apply

Tag.name: noPropertyType
Tag.description: Surpress creation of a standard property type that supports inline or by-reference encoding (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule).

Tag.name: byValuePropertyType
Tag.description: Create a property type that requires that the instance is encoded inline (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule).

Tag.name: isCollection
Tag.description: Identifies the type as an object collection.

Stereotype.name: dataType
Stereotype.notes: A structured data type without identity.

Tag.name: noPropertyType
Tag.description: Surpress creation of a standard property type that supports inline encoding (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule).

Tag.name: isCollection
Tag.description: Identifies the data type as an object collection.

Stereotype.name: union
Stereotype.notes: A structured data type without identity where exactly one of the properties of the type is present in any instance.

Tag.name: noPropertyType
Tag.description: Surpress creation of a standard property type that supports inline encoding (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule).

Tag.name: asDictionary
Tag.description: Encode code list as externally managed dictionary (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule).

Tag.name: vocabulary
Tag.description: URI of the vocabulary/code list in the WMO Codes Registry or in some external registry. The value has to be provided, if an online version of the vocabulary is used.

Tag.name: extensibility
Tag.description: This refers to extensions by a third party, not to extensions by the owner of the vocabulary; the owner will always be able to revise the vocabulary. I.e., if the value is 'none', the referenced vocabulary may not be extended by third parties; if the value is 'narrower', the vocabulary may be extended by narrower terms that have an existing term as a parent; if the value is 'any', the vocabulary may be extended by additional terms on any level. This value must be 'all', empty or missing, if the value 'vocabulary' is empty or missing; in this case any vocabulary may be used.

Tag.name: sequenceNumber
Tag.description: Unique integer value for properties of the type used to sort properties (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule)

Tag.name: xsdAsAttribute
Tag.description: Serialises UML attribute as XSD attribute (applies to ISO 19136:2007 encoding rule)
